title: Adsorption, dissociation and diffusion behavior of H2O on the PuO2(111) surface from DFT + U-D3: the role of hydrogen bonding
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,10995-11001
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA01015A, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Huang Huang, Min Zhu, Fei Wu, Longxian Li, Yan Li
Water molecules adsorb on the surface of PuO2 in molecular, dissociated, or mixed states, and intermolecular hydrogen bonds play an important role in surface behavior.
